title: Mellanox to Acquire EZchip
text:
By Tess Stynes
Mellanox Technologies Ltd. agreed Wednesday to acquire EZchip Semiconductor Ltd. for about $770 million.
Under the deal, EZchip holders would receive $25.50 per share held, a 16% premium over Tuesday's close. EZchip shares rose 14% to $25.02 in recent premarket trading. Mellanox fell 29 cents to $39.50.
The companies said the deal implies a transaction value of about $811 million, or $620 million net of cash. Company-provided deal values sometimes include debt. Representatives for the companies weren't immediately available to comment.
Mellanox provides interconnect products for data centers--essentially pipes that connect servers and other hardware to each other. The company said the acquisition is part of its strategy to become a leading data-center supplier. Yokneam, Israel-based EZchip makes chips for networking equipment for carrier, cloud and data-center networks.
The combined businesses currently have roughly 2,400 employees, and generated combined revenue of $668 million for year ended June 30.
Mellanox projects that the transaction will start boosting its earnings immediately after the deal closes, expected in the first quarter of next year.
The boards of both companies approved the deal, which requires regulatory approvals as well as the approval of EZchip shareholders.
